these shift margins, capex intensity, and governance signals into equity pricing. 4) Ground each line with explicit, source‑backed triggers and numeric anchors from the material (e.g., baseline tariffs at 10% with higher China tariffs; progress on US chip fabs; Wyoming‑scale power economics; Jackson Hole/semicapex cadence; AI compute demand), and attach the exact IDs after the facts (SGB2PAZGK, OGK8WLL69, 22PL3Q360, O4ZEED2EB, STBVARD8F, etc.) where used. 5) For each line specify a concrete invalidation or alternative path, so the Down lines reflect regime transitions (A→B→C) and the Up lines reflect regime strengthening, with explicit triggers (chip fab milestones, AI infra progress, adoptions of diversified supply chains) and probabilistic wedges: 65%, 50%, 40%, 35% respectively. 6) Eliminate extraneous cross‑references (Netflix, Costa Coffee, Disney) unless you map them to a regime impulse;
